column1: good length and a hint of curve into the corridor. Shaw on his toes to get behind the line of this and defend with soft hands

inside edge and bowled! There are two problems Shaw is contending with recently - jabbing away from the body and the ball that comes in. This is a combination of both. It's an inswinger from a good length, just a touch wide of the corridor. He's looking to drive on the rise and it's for the initial line. Gap between bat and front leg and half a stride. Not a great looking shot and it'll feel like a long walk back for him. For Starc - just another day with the pink ball. Fantastic start
good length, bit of shape in at middle stump. Solidly defended down the pitch

just short of first slip! Starc's inswinger - even the lack of it - is already playing on their minds. Pujara pushes at this length ball going across him. Caught inside the line. He always plays with soft hands though, and that probably saves him here
short of a length, dipping in and rising in the corridor. Left alone
full inswinger in the corridor. Half a stride and tentative jab to get this onto pad off the thick inside edge
appeal for lbw as Pujara is pinned deep in the crease. Slams a good length at an off stump line, brings it back in and catches him on the thigh. Going down, probably
good length and rising outside off, left alone
good length and slanting in off the surface, a bit too wide to make him play again. Left alone
full and down leg side, left alone. Searching for some swing presumably. It's not there on that occasion
full and honing into middle stump. Watchfully defended into the covers
full and in the corridor, inviting a drive that Pujara does not give him. Left alone
beaten on the cover drive. Looks to lean in to this full ball outside off, playing for the inswinger. It's rapidly past the outside edge as it goes straight on
lobs off the bat but lands safely in front of gully. Short of a length this one, rising up as he looks to defend off his toes. It catches the shoulder of the bat
full and just outside off, springs onto the front foot and jabs it through the covers for his first run
a little unsure, Pujara. Short of a length and pitching on off stump. Watches it carefully, bat ready for the one that comes in. It goes away and he doesn't follow with his hands
full at off stump, a bit of a gap between bat and front leg as he pushes this into the covers
full and wide outside off, going straight on. Reaches out with his hands, pats it to mid-off
good length and into the corridor. Nice and low on his front foot push as he defends
good length and just outside off, watchful jab to mid-off
short of a length and just outside off, left alone
short and rising up at a leg stump line. Ducks comfortably under that

good length and angling into off stump. Leans in and and loses his grip on the bat a touch, but gets the weight through this cover drive. It's dribbling into the cover boundary when Wade, running to his left from mid-off, lunges to scoop it back into play
past the outside edge. Still tentative, is Pujara. Short of a length and into the corridor. Hangs his bat inside the line of this and it straightens just a touch to beat him
good length and outside off, left alone
full and in at the stumps. Thick inside edge as he lunges forward at this. Trickles wide of mid-on who is quick enough to keep that to one
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length and at the hips, deep in the crease as he turns this to fine leg
short and climbing at an off stump line. Leaps off the ground to defend this
short and pushed across the corridor. Left alone
good length and jagging away off the pitch outside off. Left alone
full and slanting in at the stumps. Nicely forward to defend this
good length and in at off stump, watchfully defended on the front foot
catches him on the shoulder. Short and steep, jagging inwards off the surface. He walks inside the line of that and takes his eyes off, almost offering his back by the end
good length and into the stumps, blocked on the front foot
good length at off stump, solidly defended on the front foot

nearly pats it straight to short leg. Travis Head with a hurried stretch to his right, one-handed. Can't get down quickly enough. It certainly didn't die on him, but he was a little late on that. Short ball at the ribs, Mayank off his toes and closing the face on this
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
short and across off stump, left alone
short and angled wide outside off, sways out of the way
good length and in the corridor, left alone
full and wide outside off, dangled one for the drive. Left alone
139kph and at a length in the corridor. Climbs above stump height as he lets this go
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length, jagging back in and rising again. Left alone

outside edge doesn't carry. Played right under his eyes and close to the body, with soft hands. It's the perfect delivery. Good length, slanted in and landing on the seam. It's headed for middle based on the initial line but straightens off the pitch and takes the outside edge. Third slip was lunging forward and to his left to try and get to that
good length on off stump, defended solidly
138kph, short of a length and into his body. Leaves that on height
good length at off stump, solidly defended on the front foot
good length and into leg stump, gets deep in the crease and nudges to fine leg
short and moving away from outside off after it pitches. Left alone
140.2kph, good length and onto leg stump. Bat-pad into the leg side on the front foot

just past leg gully! Wide of the crease from around the wicket. A length ball into the pads. Pujara fends at it in front of his body, closed pace. It's a thick inside edge past the flying Lyon's right arm
140kph, short of a length at off stump. Defended off the back foot
142kph, full and angled into the corridor. Leans into this and gives it a pat. Between bowler and mid-off
good length at leg stump, defended on the front foot
full and into leg stump. Jabs it past the non-striker
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length and into the body. Defended to short leg with soft hands

suh-weet! Agarwal brings out the trademark check-drive, wide of mid-off. It's full, it's an invitation, and he's got a nice stride out to meet this half-volley right under his eyes. Gets the weight into the ball and it's dribbled quickly past mid-off
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length and jagging in off the seam. Defended to short leg
139.7kph, good length and just outside off. Defended on the front foot
good length and in at middle stump, solidly defended on the front foot
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
good length and into the corridor, 140.3kph. Leans in to defend and that pings off the thick inside edge to leg gully's left
137kph, short of a length and climbing in the corridor. Drops the hands, arches back, lets that go. The perfect leave
good length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket with soft hands
short of a length at middle stump, defended on the back foot with soft hands
short of a legnth at off stump, 131kph, defended off the back foot
full at middle stump, keeps the front leg leg side of this and offers the full face as he gently pushes this between mid-on and non-striker
short and wide outside off, 136kph, left alone

lovely delivery. On the fuller side of a good length - that's where Australia have mostly been this morning - just outside off, and Pujara thinks about playing before withdrawing his bat away from the line
length ball, a little wider, left alone
length ball close to off stump, gets on the front foot and defends with an open face into the backward point region
back of a length now, rising steeply in the corridor. Rises onto his toes to get on top of the bounce and keep it down by his feet
length ball on off stump, straightest line so far this over. Defended to midwicket with the full face
length ball, once again angling in towards the top of off. Went slightly wider on the crease this time. Defended back to the bowler off the front foot
fullish on off stump, driven to short extra-cover
length ball, steep bounce not far away from off stump. Agarwal trusts the bounce and Starc's angle - and the fact that there hasn't been much swing since the very early overs - and leaves it alone
back of a length, slanting a little further away from off stump, left alone
back of a length on off stump, jumps to ride the bounce and defend with soft hands, right by his feet
there's the bouncer, rising high over the stumps and causing Paine to leap vertically with arms upraised to collect after Agarwal ducks
nice follow-up, length ball tight on off stump, slanting away. Good leave. Could have been slightly fuller to force Agarwal to play, if you're being extremely nitpicky
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, gets on top of the bounce and blocks into the on side
short, rising ball, too far outside off stump to interest Pujara in playing
fuller now, drawing him forward into a defensive stroke with the angle in towards off stump. Off the inside half of the bat into front pad
back of a length, angling into middle stump. Gets on top of the bounce and defends towards short leg

length ball close to off stump, and a slight bit of confusion after Pujara defends with an open face. He wants a single but he's sent back. Wisely. Backward point didn't have a lot of distance to cover to his right
length ball angling in towards middle stump, defended towards midwicket. Loud shouts of no no no as soon as he played it

ooh, rare loose shot. Full, angling into off stump. Not quite a half-volley, but he makes a bit of room and looks to drive expansively through or maybe even over the covers. Slices it high over the gully region
full, angling in towards off stump, punched to short extra-cover
wide of the crease, digs it in short, rising over off stump. Not too steep, so he has to exert his back and hip considerably to get under it
shortish, rising ball angling into off stump. Hops to ride the bounce and defend into the off side. 146kph
shortish on off stump. Jumps and blocks into the off side
back of a length, a touch too straight, tucked off the hip to the left of long leg
well bowled, well played. Length ball in the corridor, a little bit of movement away. Pujara presses forward, shapes to defend, and then pulls his bat away from the line and lets it pass his edge
a little fuller outside off, left alone
length ball on off stump, shows the full face and blocks to mid-on
ooh, sharp bouncer over middle stump. Pujara is hurried into ducking - may have seen it a fraction late
length ball, angling in towards off stump and nipping in off the seam. Past the inside edge and onto thigh pad as he presses half-forward to defend

length ball on off stump, very well bowled. Pujara's bat comes down at an angle while defending, slicing slightly across the line, aiming to play towards mid-on. Thickish outside edge rolls towards third slip
fullish, angling into middle stumo. Stays leg-side of the ball and pushes to the left of mid-off

full, angling into off stump. It was up there to drive, but he was slightly late getting forward. Wanted to push that through the covers, and ended up playing it back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat. Fairly large gap between bat and pad because of the lack of a front-foot stride
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length, fairly wide of off stump, left alone
full, angling into leg stump, clipped to midwicket
looks for the off-stump yorker, ends up as a low full-toss that hits the bottom of Pujara's bat and jars his hands as he punches it back to the bowler

bowled him, what a delivery. Agarwal a little late getting forward, his front foot lands on its heel as this ball from the fuller side of a good length nips in from just outside off. That leaves a gap between bat and pad as he defends, and Cummins finds it to knock back the top of middle. Superlative length, found that little hole in Agarwal's defence
full, angling in towards off stump, good stride forward to defend into the cover point region
length ball on off stump, gets back and across and defends towards short leg
nice length, shifts his line wider. Kohli gets a big stride in before leaving it
now the bouncer. Great first over to Kohli. He's looking to get forward, but is able to duck under this without too much discomfort
back of a length, shifts his line outside off. Left alone
back of a length, nips back in from just outside off, hits Pujara's thigh after zipping past his inside edge. Was hurriedly trying to jam down on it
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length, angling into middle stump, defended into the on side
length ball outside off, left alone
bouncer, and Pujara ducks in an ungainly but in-control manner to get under it. Almost falls to the floor
back of a length, close to off stump but the length allows Pujara to leave with a little more confidence than if it had been a few inches fuller
fullish, angling into off stump, defended past the stumps at the other end, towards mid-on
back of a length, fifth-stump line, leaves, lifting his bat above his head to ensure he doesn't leave anything in the ball's path
back of a length, a touch straight. Kohli tucks it off his hip through backward square leg
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length, a bit of extra bounce over off stump. Plays that very well, bottom hand off the handle to cushion the impact. Hits the bat high up, on the sticker, but he keeps it down
full outside off, left alone

ooh, lovely delivery. Length ball close to off stump, angling in and forcing Pujara to play. Straightens with extra bounce, and Pujara does well to get beaten, playing close to his body and not letting his hands get drawn to the ball
back of a length, slightly wider outside off, left alone
on the fuller side of a good length. angling in towards off stump. Gets forward and lets the ball come to him before defending with soft hands towards backward point
good bowling. Angling in from slightly wider on the crease, attacking middle stump. Defended off the front foot back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
length ball close to off stump, straightens a touch. Defends with an open face into the point region, and immediately calls for the single

makes his height count straightaway. Back of a length, nipping in and rising awkwardly towards Pujara's ribcage. Gets his bottom hand off the handle and fends towards short leg, playing it into the ground. Ah, he's overstepped a touch
length ball on middle stump, defended to mid-on
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler
full, angling into off stump, not quite fully forward to drive, has to adjust with his wrists to clip that straight of mid-on
length ball on off stump, defended back down the pitch, slowly rolling towards the non-striker
length ball on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
a little fuller, slightly wide of off, big stride forward before electing to leave
fullish on off stump, lets it come and plays a checked drive to mid-off
lovely delivery, excellent leave. Fullish, fourth-stump line, and it either swings away very late or seams away, with a bit of extra lift off the pitch
length ball on middle and leg, clipped gently into the midwicket region

wow. Length ball, straightens in the fourth-stump channel and climbs steeply, towards the shoulder of Pujara's bat. Does very well to keep his bat close to his body and let himself get beaten. It's been a feature of his innings so far, not letting his hands get drawn to the movement
bouncer, Kohli ducks under it
too full, on middle stump, clipped to the left of deep square leg
back of a length, fairly wide of off, left alone
back of a length, climbing up over off stump. Gets on top of the bounce and defends square on the off side

back of a length, fourth-stump line. Straightens off the seam with some extra bounce, and Kohli is drawn to pushing at one outside off stump, for the first time in this innings. Manages to play it well enough, keeping it down into the slip cordon
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
full and into middle stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length outside off, movement away off the seam. Left alone
full and into off stump, defended down the pitch
good length and slanted in at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length and in the corridor. Left alone
good length and just outside off, gets forward to defend and it rolls into the cordon off the outside edge
just short of short leg! Good length and jagging back in off the seam. It's into Kohli's pad, but has taken something before - glove. Lobs up for Wade who lunges but can't scoop that up
good length outside off, left alone
good length wide outside off, left alone
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
good length at off stump defended into the covers
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
bouncer at an off stump line, left alone
length and into the pads, clipped to fine leg
good length and a bit of bend into middle stump. Gets forward and blocks towards mid-on
good length and angled into off stump. Shuffles and checks his flick, can't get it past mid-on
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length and in at off stump. Defended on the front foot

oooh vicious. But a great leave. Cummins in prime rhythm today. Short one climbs up from outside off and also jags inwards off the seam. Keeps following Pujara who drops the hands quickly as he arches backwards to let that go
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
good length at middle stump, tentative stab off the back foot. Thick inside edge trickles to fine leg

awkward fend and there's no leg gully. Kohli unsure how to deal with this one. Bouncer up at his front shoulder. Got inside the line and was looking to duck, but that kept coming at him and he took the right hand off and looked to pat it with the bat while being stuck in an evasive position. It took his glove and went fine
beaten. Kohli stuck on the back foot. It's a length ball that skids on in the corridor. Appears like it kept low, but it might also be a case of Kohli not being forward enough
good length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on with the angle
short of a length and seams away in the corridor. Nicely on top of that to drop it into the off side
good length at middle stump, defended on the front foot
hurried pull. Not fully balanced as he gets this out to deep square. A short one from off stump
good length at off stump, defended into the covers with soft hands
good length and onto the pads. Tickles that fine off the thigh and it slows down as it approaches the boundary
good length and into the body. Pushes on the front foot and gets it past short leg off the thick inside edge
short of a length outside off, left alone
good length outside off, lunges out at that and drives on the rise. It's off the open face and between gully and point
short of a length and rising up outside off, thinks of the jab but withdraws late to let that go
short at middle stump, ducks to let it go
short and in the corridor. Shuffles into line, gets on top of the bounce and defends into the covers. Looks like that slowed down coming on to him, he was in position early and had to adjust
short of a length and turning into the corridor. Gets steep as he backs away for the cut. Gets it fine of point
steps out and kicks it away. Not to the pitch of this
pings past silly point. Steps out again at a length ball outside off, jams at it. Not sure if there was bat on that
steps out and gets an inside edge. Out to this one at off stump, not to the pitch again, flicks hurriedly towards the leg side
length outside off, steps out and gets to the pitch of this. Jabs it into the vast expanses of the covers
good length outside off, reaches out and pokes into the covers
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length and in the corridor. Defended solidly from the crease
bouncer at off stump, sways to let that pass
short and into the hips. Gets the bottom hand off as he defends into the leg side
good length and angled into off stump from wide of the crease. Dead-batted into the pitch
past the outside edge. Straightens from a length outside off, he gets his hands away from the body to feel for this
good length on off stump, defended off the front foot
crunched over the bowler. Nicely to the pitch, is Kohli. More assured than Pujara was last over. Good length outside off, uses the turn and bounce to loft this
short of a length and turning into middle stump. Whipped into the leg side
good length outside off, defended down the pitch
good length outside off, blocked on the front foot
good length and turning into off stump, defends onto his boot
139kph bouncer at middle and off, ducks to let it go
good length and into leg stump, shuffles and flicks to fine leg's left
short and up at the ribs. Solidly defended off the back foot
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
length and into off stump. Pushed to midwicket off the back foot
short at off stump, defended off the back foot

Paine asks a question for catch behind, down leg side. Runs the DRS timer down to 2 seconds before deciding against the review. Big turn and bounce for Lyon. Short of a length and spinning down leg side. He was beaten on the attempted glance. Lyon didn't think anything of it. Replays suggest there might have been glove on that. Seemed to be a tiny spot on the thermal imaging
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, gets forward and flicks it back to the bowler
length and turning into middle stump, patted to square leg off the back foot
short of a length, rising into the body. Clipped to backward square off the back foot
full outside off, reaches out and drives with the turn to deep mid-on
whipped through midwicket. Good length and in the corridor. Gets the front leg across and that head is so still as he fetches this from outside off
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
yorker at off stump, jammed into the covers
full on middle stump, shuffles and flicks to midwicket
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length and turning rapidly into leg stump. Nudged to short fine off the back foot
good length outside off, steps out and whips firmly into the leg side. Can't beat short midwicket to the left
good length and turning into off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, cramped by the turn on the back foot. Pushes it back to the bowler
good length on middle stump, defended to short fine off the thick outside edge
good length in the corridor, punched to midwicket's right off the back foot
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
good length outside off, punched on the rise to mid-off
good length just outside off, pats it to point's right. Wants to pinch the run but Pujara says no
full and just outside off, driven into the off side
short and wide outside off, left alone
short at off stump, defended off the back foot
kicks it away. Good length outside off, jumps at it and can't get to the pitch
lobs up off his body and short leg is diving across the pitch trying to get this. That kicked up from outside off, not sure if he got bat or glove on that as he looked to smother it
good length and into middle, defended past short leg
short of a length and into the body, defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off, steps out and offers the pad
good length outside off, steps out and plants the front leg out. It pings down the pitch. The bat was withdrawn behind the front pad
well played. Length ball, slanting across to off stump, no swing. Stays back, lets it come, and dabs gently into the cover point region for the quick single
shortish in the corridor, left alone
length ball angling in towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length. angling in towards off stump, gets on top of the bounce and defends towards midwicket
back of a length, angling in over off stump, stays slightly leg-side of the ball, rises to his toes, and defends right on top of the bounce, into the pitch
full, angling into middle stump, almost in the blockhole. Jabbed back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, stretches out to defend into the on side with the turn
once again that loop outside off and the big stretch from Kohli. Defended on the bounce to short leg
a little flatter, goes back and clips into the on side
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
tossed up slow, pitching on off stump. Gets a big stride out to clip into the square-leg region

quick flight outside off, and Pujara kicks it straight to silly point. Australia appeal, not sure if it's for a catch or for lbw. Not given, not reviewed. Not sure he left his bat or glove near that, but we'll have to see replays. The quicker pace foxed Pujara there. Made him kick out without stepping out of the crease
back of a length on off stump, defended into the point region
back of a length on off stump, defended with soft hands into the gully region

lucky for Kohli, that lands in no-man's land. Shortish, and Kohli looks to work it against the angle. Extra bounce, and it hits his glove and pops up high, but lands in unoccupied territory in the backward square leg region. The physio comes out to check on Kohli. Might have jammed his right thumb against the handle
short, rising ball slanting across into the corridor. Shuffles across to defend to gully
lovely delivery. Length, slanting across and finishing in the fourth-stump channel. Good leave

short, gets up to chest height over off stump, Kohli plays a controlled checked pull, just turns his wrists over at impact and barely has a follow-through, and he finds the gap to the right of midwicket
down the track and Lyon floats this wider and fuller, allowing Pujara to reach the pitch of it and drive through point. Slices it a little, off the outer half of the bat
tossed up wide of off, stretches out and pads it away. Not enough turn so early in the game to get an lbw from there
again the line wide of off. A couple of steps out, bat behind pad, kicked loopily over silly point's head
nicely bowled. Full, angling in and pitching on off. Stretches out and clips watchfully into the on side
a touch shorter, spinning in towards off stump. Goes back and punches watchfully to point
again the wide line and some flight. Stretches out to pad it, and it turns less than expected and misses the pad. Straight into Paine's gloves
back of a length, steep bounce over off stump. Rides it and defends with soft hands, into the pitch
short, a bit of width, but the bounce forces Kohli to check himself and not play a full-blooded cut. Taps down on top of the bounce to the man at a deepish point
shortish over off stump, rides the bounce and defends with soft hands to midwicket
full on off stump, slightly overpitched, uses the angle and clips to the left of long leg
back of a length outside off, left alone
length ball close to off stump, steps across and defends into the point region

this is a better line, I think. Straighter, bringing those leg-side catchers into play. Goes back, looks to whip it away, and the ball hits the inside half of the bat and flies to the left of the diving leg gully fielder
tossed up slower outside off, stretches out to clip watchfully into the on side
tossed up, off-stump line, presses forward and clips it square on the leg side
a bit flatter outside off, gets back and across and defends with soft hands into the on side
slow loop outside off, big stretch out to clip to midwicket
nicely played. Long-on is back, and the flighted ball is clipped there for a single after Lyon slightly overpitches a flighted ball outside off
back of a length, tight line in the corridor, left alone
full on off stump, defended past the bowler to mid-off
back of a length close to off stump, gets behind it to defend into the on side

full outside off, and that's the first time Kohli's attempted that hard-hands cover drive as far as I can remember. Not quite up there for the drive, and he plays with a slightly open face and the thick edge flies between second slip and gully
full, angling into off stump, blocked to mid-on
shortish on off stump, hops across and clips watchfully to midwicket
bouncer rising high over off stump, ducks his upper body neatly under it
back of a length, spinning in from outside off, goes back and whips to midwicket

just a touch short, rocks back, makes a bit of room, and picks up his first boundary with a forcing punch through cover point. Quick feet, quick hands too. It's taken him 148 balls to pick up this boundary
and then he gets two in two. Typical Pujara. Skips out, expecting the flight, and reaches the pitch of this off-stump ball to whip it to the right of midwicket. Super shot
skips out again, the line is close enough to off stump to whip it into the square-leg region
flat length ball attacking off stump. Well bowled. Keeps his pad out of the way and defends to short leg

tossed up a little higher outside off. Goes forward to play pad-first, and the ball flies past the left hand of the diving silly point fielder. Pad onto bat? Yup. Extra bouce, and the glove being really close to the flap of the pad
bouncer over off stump, ducks nice and low and stays under it
back of a length on off stump. Defended into the point region. Bat sliced across the line ever so slightly, and the ball squirted away off the outside half of it
full, on the pads, and there's a fielder at forward square leg to stop exactly that sort of flick
overpitched, angling down leg, clipped to long leg
back of a length close to off stump, defended towards point
length ball close to off stump, presses forward to block into the covers
floats it up wide of off, and Pujara steps out and kicks it back to the bowler
flat, turning down the leg side. Looks to flick and misses, and there's a huge orchestrated appeal from the close-in fielders. I don't think they thought it hit anything. Maybe thigh pad
again just a touch short. This is the result of all the pressure Pujara puts on spinners with his forays down the pitch. Skips back, makes some room, and punches through cover point

steps out and there's a huge appeal after the ball lobs off the pad to the fielder at leg gully. Not given, and Australia have reviewed. They did so especially because Pujara seemed to start walking before stopping in his tracks, and you can see why. Lyon's made the big breakthrough here. His changes of pace today have been excellent. Just a bit quicker, and Pujara can't get anywhere near the pitch of it to kick it away. Has to try and defend hurriedly, and there's extra bounce, and he gets a thick edge into pad, which lobs up to that man at leg gully. Huge breakthrough just when Pujara seemed set to turn the momentum around
quickish, turning in from outside off, stays back and defends it back to the bowler
tossed up slower outside off, draws Rahane into the forward stretch to defend to short leg
shortish, angling down leg, tucked off the hip to deep backward square leg
fullish outside off, left alone
ooh, past the edge. Back of a length, straightens in the corridor, and Rahane looks to defend off the back foot and is beaten. Didn't let his hands get drawn to the movement, though
in the blockhole, almost, on middle stump. Clipped to midwicket
short, rising ball over off stump. Sways his upper body away from the line
back of a length outside off, left alone
tossed up slow outside off, big stretch out, defended towards short leg off the inside half of the bat

this is dangerous from Kohli, this big stretch at the flighted ball wide of off. Doesn't get near the pitch, and then his hands take over, a turn of the wrists, and that runs away to the left of leg gully, off the inside half
tossed up outside off, stretches out to defend into the off side
back of a length, and Rahane gets back and across to defend into the off side
nicely bowled, well played. Good length, a bit quicker. Presses forward to defend, doesn't let his bat go searching in front of his pad, and almost lets ball hit bat. Into the on side

beautifully bowled. After that quicker, straighter one, here's one dangled up slow and quite full, wide of off. Plays a half-hearted push away from the body, not the full-blooded drive, and slices it through the backward point region
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, punched watchfully to point
shortish, angling into middle stump. Gets on top of the bounce and defends into the on side
length ball tight on off stump. Gets forward to defend with soft hands, behind square on the off side
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
length ball close to off stump, defended into the covers. Top stuff from Australia's fifth bowler
tossed up wide of off, stretches out to clip it into the on side, looking for the single to long-on, but short midwicket moves quickly to intercept
dangled up even wider, stretches out for a push into the point region. This time the keeper moves swiftly to cut off the single
skips out of his crease now, clips the flighted ball back to the bowler. Slightly closer to off stump
goes a bit shorter, goes back to try and work it past midwicket. Not as much turn as he expects, so he can't get the power or placement he wants
flatter, spins in towards off stump. Goes back to clip into the ground, to short leg
slow flight wide of off, gets a big stride forward, lets the ball hit his bat, and roll out into the point region so he can steal a single
back of a length on off stump, punched to deep cover
back of a length, spins away from off stump, punched past the diving short cover fielder, towards mid-off
loopy full-toss outside off, punched to deep cover
flat length ball spinning away from off stump, steps across and clips against the turn to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, goes on with the angle, clipped to the right of midwicket
tossed up nicely on middle stump, nice stride forward to smother it
past the outside edge. Lovely drift away from outside off, draws Kohli into the cover drive and beats him
good length and into the pads, dabbed to backward square off the back foot
good length outside off, blocked on the front foot
short of a length and hurrying him at off stump, backs away and cuts to cover point
dropped short. Gets an under-edge on the pull, can't beat backward square to the left
tossed up outside off, blocked on the front foot
good length and down leg side, shuffles and can't get bat on the glance
135kph, good length and at off stump. Gets forward to defend, off the outside half to gully
short of a length outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, shuffles and clips to deep square
140kph, full and at off stump. Blocked into the covers
good length and at off stump, solidly blocked on the front foot
tossed up outside off, reaches out and flicks down to deep mid-on
good length and spinning in at off stump, defended on the front foot
neatly done. A touch too full from Lyon. Outside off and drifting away but Rahane's foot is quickly out to the pitch of it. Driven through the vacant covers
short and turning into the corridor. Punched to cover point's right off the back foot

too full again. Lobbed wide outside off, Kohli is to the pitch and gives it a gentle punch. Green chases from cover point and manages to make contact with a big dive, but his body has taken the ball over the line with it
good length on middle, pushed into the leg side off the back foot
136kph, good length and in the corridor. Nicely behind the line to defend this
bouncer at a leg stump line, ducks under it
good length and a touch wide outside off, 141kph. Left alone
good length on leg stump, defended on the back foot
good length in the corridor, defended on the back foot
138kph, short and in the corridor. Comfortably sways away from that
good length and down leg, left alone
thick outside edge. Beaten by the drift and dip. Good length and wide outside off, chases with his hands for a big drive. It's ended up square of cover point
short of a length and ripping into the body. Hurriedly glanced to backward square
short of a length and turning in outside off. Cut to cover point
short of a length and pushed across off stump. Backs away and cuts to point's left
short of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot

inside edge past short leg for the fifty. It's been a gritty innings, with some luck, and not his usual flair. But a very well constructed one. This time he's looking to punch through cover at a length ball outside off
short at off stump, looks for the pull, through it too early and cops that one the body
good length on leg stump, pushed to deep square's right off the back foot
short and in the corridor. Defended down the pitch
bouncer in the corridor, left alone
good length and into off stump, defended solidly
good length and at off stump, drops it into the off side with soft hands to pinch the run
good length and dipping at off stump, plants the front leg across and flicks to midwicket
good length outside off, reaches out and gets low as he flicks to deep square
looks for the sweep which might be a first today. It's outside off, and it turns into his body which is outside off too
good length on off, gets big as he looks to defend. Bat-pad situation, but safely into the pitch
good length and turning into off stump, defended off the back foot
top edge is safely wide of backward square. Brings out the sweep again. Full and outside off, gets down and has a swish from underneath this climbing ball
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short and climbing past the corridor, left alone
good length and just outside off, gets forward and stabs to deep point
good length at off stump, dropped into the vacant point region for another single
145kph, short of a length at leg stump. Leaps for the glance, cops it on the thigh guard
good length in the corridor, left alone
short of a length in the corridor, left alone
good length and a hint of curve into the corridor. Left alone
good length, 134.5 kph in the corridor. Blocked on the front foot
134kph, short and slanted in at middle. Sways to let it go
full and at middle stump. Flicked to midwicket
full and just outside off, defended on the front foot
141kph, short of a length and in the corridor. Punched to point off the back foot

sweet timing on this. Good length ball just outside off, gets his weight onto the back foot and caresses this through vacant cover. Lyon chases from point and puts in a slide to get this back into play. It's hit his body on first impact and dribbled away as he makes contact with the padding
146kph, good length and just outside off. Blocked on the front foot
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
short ad just outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
135kph, good length outside off and a lot of wobble as Rahane lets this go
good length and just outside off, punched on the rise to extra cover
136kph, good length and swerving into the corridor. Soldily defended on the front foot
good length and into off stump, defended off the back foot
appeal for lbw as Kohli gets forward to defend. This full ball dips in late and it's a bat-pad call. No review
<b>direct hit<b/> at the striker's end. Length and into the body, he pats it into the leg side. Midwicket slides with an under-arm flick as Rahane stretches and dives. Just makes it
good length at leg stump, shuffles and clips it fine
nails the pull shot. Short at middle stump, sitting up nicely. He waits on that a tad, and then, swat. Quickly into the boundary
good length at off stump, inside edge onto pad as he looks to push this into the covers
good length, 144kph, wide outside off. Left alone
good length at middle stump, shuffles and tucks it to deep square off the back foot
good length and wide outside off, left alone
136kph, short of a length, wobbling again outside off. Left alone
good length and just outside off, defended to point on the front foot
oh beauty! Looks like a slow away-floater. Yes it is. Knuckle delivery. Good length and swerving away from the corridor as Kohli comes forward. Past the edge and dies on Paine
carted over the leg umpire. Short and about stomach height this time. Swivels and puts this away with authority
short of a length outside off, left alone
good length and pushed across the corridor, left alone
143kph, good length and just outside off. Defended on the back foot
good length and just outside off, shuffles and carves this through cover on the up
full and very wide outside off, 142kph. Left alone
beaten on the cut. 143kph, short and rising outside off. Got caught under this
beaten again. 145kph and climbing as it slides across the corridor from a length. Rahane on the back foot again, swishing at it
full and just outside off, shuffles and stabs to mid-on
good length and outside off, left alone
132kph, short of a length in the corridor, left alone
good length at off stump, shuffles and flicks to midwicket
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length and turning into his hips. Pushed to backward square off the back foot
short of a length and pushed through quicker in the corridor, left alone
good length and dipping outside off, reaches out and flicks to midwicket
good length and turning into off stump, defended from deep in the crease
cuts through the batsman and keeper. That bounce is back. He has changed ends. Short of a length and rising over middle stump as Rahane shapes to back away and cut this
short and turning into off, makes room and cuts behind point. Addendum: A short run was called, the batsmen ran two
131kph, good length and into the pads. Clipped to midwicket
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full and wide outside off, left alone
good length and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
thick outside edge past gully's outstretched left hand. Soft hands as he gets forward to defend this length ball outside off. It straightens on him, but it's straight into the turf
good length at off stump, solidly defended from the crease
good length outside off, blocked on the front foot
overpitched wide outside off, reaches out and chops down on it to get it through the covers
short of a length, turning into off stump. Chopped past point
good length at middle stump, reaches out and flicks to midwicket's right
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
good length and turning into leg stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length, close to off stump, stabbed to cover point
fullish, fifth-stump line, left alone

ooh, edge doesn't carry. It's happened a few times today. Combination of soft hands from Rahane and the slowness of the pitch. There's bounce, but not a whole lot of pace. On the fuller side of a length, and Rahane is half-fotward in defence. The line forces him to play, and it straightens to take the edge, but it falls well short of second slip
edged again, and it runs away between second slip and gully. A touch shorter, similar sort of behaviour, straightens in the corridor. Stuck on the crease, and he pokes at it with an open face
length ball, angling into the stumps, clipped through forward square leg
length ball on off stump, defended to short cover
drops short, spinning towards the thigh pad, pulled to the right of deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, and it lands a touch too full. Stroked away with ease, to the left of short extra-cover
flat length ball spinning into middle and leg, goes deep in his crease to work it into the backward square leg region
back of a length, spins in from outside off, goes back to whip to midwicket
down the track to this flighted ball on a middle-and-leg line, clipped down to long-on
flatter, back of a length outside off, goes back and across to defend with the turn into the on side
bouncer, rising steeply over off stump. Rahane sways his upper body away from the line, dropping his head into the leg side. Leaves the bat pointing up, though it's well away from the ball's path
length ball on off stump, stays back and lets it come on, pushes into the covers looking for one. The bowler moves quickly to the ball to cut off the single
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Rahane lets it come right up under his eye, defends down by his feet with soft hands
length ball on off stump, defended to point

tests him with the short ball, and that's not fully controlled, but Rahane manages to put it in the gap to the left of long leg. Difficult ball, rising over his back shoulder, but he sees it early and is into the hook quickly. Meets it in front of his body, but can't control the height of it. Carries all the way over the rope, so he won't mind. Wasn't off the edge - met it with his bat pointing up
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
shortish outside off, left alone
flat length ball spinning towards leg stump, goes back and works it to backward square leg
nicely flighted, pitches on off and spins into leg stump. Gets forward and clips watchfully behind square
tossed up on off stump, and this time he gets to the pitch of it with his front-foot stretch. Clipped down to long-on
nice judgment of length. Spinning in towards off stump, goes right back to tuck it to the left of backward square leg
tossed up on leg stump, gets nicely forward to work it along the floor to deep midwicket

full, flighted ball on off stump, and a mix-up ends this promising stand. Yikes. Rahane gets forward to play the checked drive, well within range of the fielder at mid-off, who's hurtling forward at speed. Rahane takes a couple of steps out, Kohli responds, then Rahane sends him back, by which time he's already halfway down the pitch and in no position to get back. What a moment, ends a brilliantly controlled knock from Kohli, and brings the new batsman in with the second new ball looming
bouncer to start, outside off, easily evaded
length ball nipping in towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler
beauty. Draws Vihari forward with the length in the corridor, and gets it to straighten past the outside edge of his defensive bat
a little fuller, a little wider, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, excellent carry through to Paine after Vihari leaves, careful that he gets his bat and gloves up above his head and away from the ball's path

ooh, another edge fails to carry. No question of soft hands here. Third slip is in place, and Vihari, new to the crease, isn't fully forward to drive this well pitched-up ball in the corridor. Straightens on him, and he goes pretty hard at the drive, but the ball goes low towards third slip and bounces short of the fielder, Labuschagne
length ball spinning in towards leg stump, worked away through square leg
flatter one, turns from close to off stump. Just lets it spin and hit his pad on the back foot. Was turning down leg
now he flights one higher and wider outside off, with lots of overspin. Left alone
length ball, drawing Vihari forward with flight and turning into the stumps with bounce. Clipped neatly into the on side
shot. Excellent stride forward to pounce on some marginal overpitching, and drives into the wide open spaces in the covers, below the feet of the jumping silly point fielder
dips onto a better length outside off, plus Rahane is shorter, so he defends respectfully back to the bowler
nice. Excellent line, nipping in from not too far outside off, but Vihari trusts the bounce and leaves on length. Bounced pretty much over the top of off stump
fuller now, angling into off stump, gets forward to block it back to the bowler
back of a length close to off stump, gets right on top of the bounce, dabs gently to the left of short extra, and goes yeahyeahyeahyeah early and loud
digs it in short close to off stump. Leaves the batsman after pitching, and Rahane drops his gloves and leaves it alone
length ball in the corridor, steep bounce again, left alone. Went wider on the crease to try and make Rahane play for the angle, but the length and Green's height made it easier for Rahane to leave
length ball angling into leg stump, defended into the on side
length ball slanting across to off stump, defended into the covers. No real swing just yet
fullish, angling across to off stump, no swing back. Blocked to short extra-cover
shot. This is his favourite area - mid-on and midwicket. Overpitches on off stump, and he shows the full face and drives between the bowler and mid-on

gone, that looked plumb! Was he beaten for pace there? It's given, and Rahane was walking away, but Vihari calls him back and asks him to review. Full, maybe swinging back a touch. Rahane is stuck on the crease, feet going nowhere, and he jams his bat down in a slicing motion to keep it out as it tails in late. Not too extravagantly at all. Pitching just inside the line of leg stump, swinging to hit leg stump, and India lose their review. Massive wicket, this
good length and at the stumps, defended on the front foot
length and at the stumps, blocked on the front foot
good length and jagging back into the stumps, defended off the back foot
beaten. Short of a length and curving away from the corridor as he has a jab at it
full outswinger in the corridor, looks to flick, closes the face on it too soon and gets a leading edge through point
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
length at leg stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length, swinging down leg, looks to glance but can't connect
appeal for lbw as Vihari falls over a flick. It isn't the most confident appeal, and it isn't given, but Australia have reviewed. That's swung and beaten him on pace, and it's umpire's call
full inswinger in the corridor, driven firmly to point
good length on leg stump, defended on the front foot
good length and in the corridor, watches it through as he lets it go
short of a length across the corridor, left alone
oh that's a good-looking drive. Full outswinger outside off, gets low, on his back knee, and drills it through the covers

that looks dead in front! No vigour at all in terms of a review from Vihari this time. Good length ball, sliding straight on at an off stump line. Vihari brings down an angled bat and is beaten on the inside edge by a long way. It hits his back leg in front of off. Once again, a very odd shot. I wonder if visibility has anything to do with this. Whether it does or not, it's Australia's premier fast bowlers doing the job even late in the day. What a wonderful day they've had, pure quality
full and just outside off, punched to mid-off's left off the front foot
left on height. No visibility issues if Saha meant this leave. Close. Good length, slammed into the corridor, nipping back in and sailing over off stump
good length at off stump, defended to slip off the back foot
good length and in at middle stump, gets forward and low to defend. Rapped on the glove, it appears
full inswinger, starts at leg stump and keeps sliding on as he looks to flick
short and pushed wide outside off. 141kph. Looks to cut hard and misses
nicely played. Full wobbly delivery at off stump at 145kph. Offers the full face and drives it past the non-striker
top edge is short of fine leg. Short and at the stomach. Takes the pull on and is not in full control as it gets big on him
good length and into leg stump, squeezed past short leg with a closed face
142kph and squares him up. Short of a length and into middle stump, then it pitches and goes away as Saha looks to defend for a leg stump line
length ball on off stump, straightening just a touch. Defended back to the bowler off the front foot
full on off stump, not much of a stride forward from Ashwin. There's some outswing, and he looks to drive through mid-off and ends up edging thickly to the right of gully
length ball on off stump, punched with the swing to short extra-cover
back of a length close to off stump, smartly played. Lets it come on, and pushes to the right of point. Met that right under his eye
full outside off. Looks to drive away from his body, and plays it straighter than intended, off the inside half of the bat to short extra-cover
back of a length, nips in sharply with extra bounce. Looks to hop and ride the bounce to defend, and the ball zips past his inside edge and hits thigh pad
back of a length, a touch too straight, tucked off the hip to long leg
length ball, nips in towards the thigh pad. Rides the bounce well and clips it down in front of short leg
back of a length, Hazlewood strays too straight again. Worked off the hip to long leg
shot. Full, angling into middle stump, just shows it the full face and punches between the stumps at the other end and mid-on
length ball close to off stump, gets forward, head on top of the ball, and opens his bat face to steer it wide of gully
length ball on off stump, a bit of extra bounce. Saha plays that very well, raising himself on his toes to get on top of it and defend close to his body, dropping the ball right by his feet

back of a length, straightens towards off stump. Manages to keep it down towards gully despite getting into an uncomfortable position while defending, dropping his bottom hand hurriedly. He plays almost all his shots from the same initial position, a firm half-forward press
full outside off, gets forward for the push drive to short extra
length ball on off stump, gets his front leg smartly out of the way and blocks it back to the bowler with a straight bat

short, gets up above Ashwin's left shoulder, and he takes on the hook. Doesn't control it perfectly, but times it well enough to find the gap, just out of reach of long leg running frantically to his right
fullish, angling down leg, tickled down to the right of fine leg. May have been just pad
length ball angling in towards off stump, a bit of extra bounce. Nips past the inside edge of his hurried defensive jab, or maybe inside edge onto pad
back of a length, again it nips back to hit thigh pad, catching Ashwin mid-shuffle. Tried to jam his bat down quickly but couldn't bring it down quickly enough
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler

ooh, tight leave, but I think he left it on length. In which case it's a very good leave. Length ball, nipping in and not missing off stump by much at all, in terms of line, but it misses by about a foot in terms of height
length ball on off stump, a little fuller than the previous one. Defended into the on side, bottom hand dropping off the handle

full outside off, and that's a lovely shot from Saha, gets his weight forward even though his foot doesn't go that far. Gets his head more or less over the ball, and frees his arms to drive smoothly through cover point
good leave again, not too far outside off but just short enough for Saha to trust the bounce
back of a length outside off, left alone, and that is... stumps, yes.
bouncer to start, rising steeply over off stump. Sways his upper body away from the line and evades it well
length ball straightening towards off stump. Gets his weight forward into a push towards point. He's looking for one, but it's too close to the fielder to allow it

edged, and Cummins finds a hole in Ashwin's technique. Great bowling, tests him with a fuller length outside off, and he doesn't get forward at all. Just pushes at it with hard hands, and the ball straightens to take his edge through to Tim Paine. It's the first outside-edge dismissal of the innings
what a ball to greet the new man. Angling into off stump, fullish length, jagging away sharply to beat the outside edge as Umesh jabs at it from the crease
back of a length close to off stump, hops to ride the bounce and defend to backward point
ooh, not the greatest footwork. Full, angling into middle and leg and straightening a touch. Jabs at it without getting either of his feet across, and squirts a thick edge down to third man
full on middle and off, clears his front leg and drives firmly back to the bowler
shortish, at the hip, jumps to try and get on top of the bounce and work it square, ends up popping it briefly in the air,  but safely, into the backward square leg region

gone, that was one of those dismissals where you get a loose shot but kind of understand why the batsman played it. Didn't play it very well, though. Smart bowling from Starc, slants out a full, wide tempter, and Saha throws his hands at it, looking to drive through the covers. All he manages is an edge through to Paine. With the bounce on this pitch, the angled bat is an invitation for trouble. Could have maybe gone harder so the edge would fly over the cordon
fullish on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length, a bit of bounce, slanting across to middle or middle and off. Squared up completely, but manages to keep his defensive push down into the covers
goes short now, slanting away from off stump. Left alone
bouncer angling in over leg stump and rising menacingly towards the head. Manages to duck under it, though not too far under
shot. Latches onto the chance when Cummins bowls one full, angling into the stumps. Clears his front leg slightly and slogs it powerfully over wide mid-on
not the most unexpected reaction. Digs it in short again, but outside off. Backs away to try and make extra room for the big pull, but can't connect
bouncer over leg stump, ducks under
ooh, big hoick. Cummins goes length now, angling into the stumps, but the ball bounces over the stumps as Umesh clears his front leg and swivels violently through the slog
full now, on off stump, and Umesh shows it as straight a bat as possible to squeeze a single into the covers. Just the outcome he'd have wanted
full at the stumps. Looks to work it away leg side, but closes his bat face a touch early and squeezes it into the off side off the leading edge

full on middle stump, and Umesh goes for the big slog but his weight is falling backwards as he plays it, and he slices it high in the air, behind the bowler, and mid-on runs across and takes a very well-judged catch
length ball slanting away from off stump, left alone
length ball zipping away outside off, has a poke at it and misses
fullish, a little wider, left alone

full, slanting away from off stump, and that's well played by Bumrah. Not off the very middle of the bat, but close enough, as he gets a big stride forward - and that's the key - and slices this drive through point

it doesn't matter. Digs it in short, and it rears towards the top of Shami's helmet. All he can do is get his hands up in a desperate attempt to fend it away, and gloves the loopiest, simplest catch to short leg
good start, steep bounce from a length in the corridor, the merest hint of shape back into the left-hander. Left alone
back of a length, slanting into the corridor. Left alone

beauty. Shifts his length very slightly fuller, and gets Wade to defend from the crease. He plays because he knows Umesh can swing it back, and the line is close to off stump, but it carries on with the angle and beats the edge
beats him again! A little fuller still, and this one seams away off the pitch as Wade props forward to defend
fuller still, a little wider, inviting the drive away from the body. Left alone
length ball, slanting away into the fifth-stump channel. Wade leaves again. Excellent first over
length ball in the corridor, left alone
length ball, some steep spring off the surface as Burns leaves again
ooh, great bowling. Similar length, angling in slightly closer to off stump to force a defensive push from Burns without a whole lot of footwork. Then it nips away off the seam to beat his edge
back of a length, a little wider, left alone
full now, angling in and close to off stump. Good stride forward to block into the point region
pulls his length back a bit, fairly tight line outside off. Burns leaves, trusting the bounce
lovely length, slanting across Wade and making him play with the threat of inswing in the back of his mind. Doesn't swing, and it zips past the edge
now it does swing, from around off stump. Looks to work it leg side, but the ball bounces steeply and hits his thigh pad after swerving past the inside edge
length ball on off stump, defended into the on side
length ball, shifts his line wider outside off. Too wide to make Wade play
back of a length, slanting across into the corridor, gets nicely behind it to defend into the point region
shortish, climbs steeply and straightens into Wade as he tries to ride the bounce and play it down into the leg side. Past his inside edge and smacks into his stomach

ooh, squared up slightly. Just back of a length, angling into off stump. Straightens just a touch as Burns' bat comes down at an angle in defence. Squirted off the edge, but downwards, bouncing well short of third slip
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball angling into middle stump. Presses forward and clips to mid-on, playing slightly around his front pad. That will interest Bumrah for sure
back of a length outside off, left alone
full in the corridor, left alone, carries through at shin height to Saha
length ball outside off, left alone, and India have begun with four straight maidens
back of a length, a bit of swing in from a straight line. Looks to tuck it off his hip, but the ball beats his inside edge and hits his thigh

well bowled. Similar initial line, but it keeps going with the angle across. Wade shuffles across to try and work it leg side, but spots the lack of swing just in time to block it back to the bowler while squaring up
on the shorter side of a length, close to off stump, defended back to Umesh. He's been more off stump than corridor in this over so far

first runs. Lovely shot from Wade. Not a particularly bad ball, just slightly shorter, and that means the angle across gives him a little more width too. Gets up on his toes and punches it away through the vacant cover region
at the hip, tucked down to long leg
good ball, back of a length and angling in, not far from off stump at all. Burns leaves on length, and Saha catches it above his left shoulder
back of a length on off stump, jumps to ride the bounce and knock it into the vacant cover point region
length ball angling into off stump. Gets across and works it to the left of long leg. Again seemed to play around his front pad a little, but he got his head over the ball and played it well
length ball, too wide to make Burns play
on the fuller side of a length, fifth-stump line, big stride forward before leaving

buncer, keeps following Burns, and there's an appeal for a catch in the cordon as the ball pops up in that direction. Off the shoulder, kept his bat and gloves just about out of the way. Jags back in off the seam, and Burns, whose initial movement is a forward press, has nowhere to go
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length, angling into off stump, a hint of inswing too. Defended back down the pitch. He wants to be a bit fuller than that
length ball, fifth-stump channel, a little bit of inswing, left alone
full outside off, and Umesh has a man at cover to stop the drive. No third slip, remember
length ball, angling into the fourth-stump channel. Defended into the covers
fuller now, angling into the corridor from wide of the crease. Good leave
length ball, too wide outside off to make Wade play
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball on off stump, lets it come on and dabs gently into the cover point region to pick up a good quick single
a bit of inward seam movement from just outside off, half-hearted appeal after Wade is struck on the thigh pad while looking to defend on the hop. Too high
fuller now, a touch straight, middle-and-leg-ish. Tucked away down to long leg
back of a length outside off, left alone
full now, angling into off stump, defended to mid-on
back of a length, angling into off stump, hops up and tucks it watchfully into the leg side
short outside off, looks to pull but he's a little late on it. Hits high on the bat and bounces down to midwicket
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length, angling into off stump. A bit of extra bounce and Wade adjusts to defend into the off side. Hit the splice of the bat but he played with nice, soft hands
and Wade turns his back on a bouncer. It's angling into him from round the wicket, and it doesn't get up as high as he expects. Hits him on the side, near the front elbow
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
good length and in the corridor, no movement. Forward to defend
full and into middle stump, gets forward and nearly gets tangled up. Plays in front of the pad and squeezes it past square leg off the thick inside edge
full at the stumps, walks into that forward defence
good length and straightening from off stump, defended on the front foot
137.9kph, good length and slanted into the stumps. Solidly defended
full and onto middle stump, flicked to midwicket
full and very wide outside off, left alone
good length and into the corridor, defended off the back foot
short and in the corridor, nicely behind the line to defend this
full and just outside off, nice stride out as he drives to mid-off
short and slanted in at a middle stump line. Ducks to let that go
short of a length and into the body. Allows that onto the body, nudges it past mid-on
good length and into the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length and wide outside off, left alone
short at a middle stump line, ducks to let it go
good length and into off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length and in the corridor. Watchful cut to point's right
short and in the corridor, 131.9kph, defended on the back foot
good length and into off stump, defended from deep in the crease
bouncer slanted in at a leg stump line, ducks to let it go
good length and into middle stump, stabbed to mid-on with the angle
turns his back again. Cops another one on the arm, just above the elbow. Short one slanted into the corridor and he's not in position to let that go
good length and in the corridor, shuffles and gets it onto his body off the inside edge as he looks to defend
short and down leg side, sways to let it pass
half an appeal for lbw as Burns lunges forward outside off. Inside edge onto pad on the forward block
short and down leg side, left alone
good length, 137.9kph, in the corridor. Left alone
nice transfer of weight into this. Good signs indeed, for Burns. Gets forward and close to this length ball outside off, opens the face late and it's past point
short and climbing at the chest. Awkwardly fended into the leg side

appeal for lbw and given. Wade reluctantly reviews it. Looks good if it's hit him in line. He's deep in the crease, walking across off stump and is struck around the knee roll. Bumrah is around the wicket, remember. Slants it in from a length and raps him as he's moving. That's hitting middle stump. Umpire's call. They lose the opener, retain the review
short and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone

between slip and keeper! Another edge dies on the cordon. Saha lunging desperately to his right and forward, one-handed, but that evades him. A good length ball in the corridor, straightening as Labuschagne offers a dead bat. Edge barely stays in the air
short of a length outside off, left alone
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
good length and into middle stump, dropped pitch side on the leg side for the single
138kph and into his body. Short and steep and vicious. It's up at Marnus' front shoulder and he stands tall and fends awkwardly, with the bottom hand coming off. Cops it on the collar bone
good length and cutting in from outside off, left alone
through the cordon again. Good length and into off stump. Hangs back and defends with a dead bat again. Thick outside edge between second slip and gully. Agarwal puts in a slide to retrieve
short of a length and into middle stump. Shuffles across and uses the angle to tickle that fine
good length in the corridor, defended into the leg side
good length and at off stump, defended to gully off the front foot
good length, 138kph and wide of the corridor. Left alone
short of a length and up at the hips. Glanced along the floor to leg gully
bouncer at middle stump, ducks to let it go
good length and into off stump, 137ph, blocked solidly on the front foot

another lbw, looks very good for India. Burns reviews. It's a Bumrah yorker - or one that Burns has made with his stride. Middle and leg stump line. He walks across the stumps and gets locked up with the front leg across into the off side. He's hit his toe with the bat and that shows a mark on Snicko. Umpire is satsified there's no bat on it. And Burns himself seemed to know it because he consulted for a while before taking the review. The only thing that can save him now is if that ball is sliding down leg. It is not. Umpire's call. This one decidedly closer than the last one, it's just about brushing leg stump. Burns not pleased about that. His dogged innings has ended less than ten minutes before the long break. Bumrah has swung the session India's way
good length and in the corridor, shuffles and defends from the crease
short of a length and rising into his mid-riff. Looks to flick but cops that on the box
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length and into middle stump. Shuffles to dab into the leg side and cops it on the pad. An appeal from India, but a subdued one
good length at middle stump, shuffles and clips to deep square

Bumrah drops a sitter! Very conscious of the boundary padding behind him, probably not aware of how much room he had. Because he's jumped up running to his right from fine leg where a jump wasn't required. This was straight into his pouch, stomach height and floating nicely. Labuschagne took on the bouncer from middle stump and got a top edge. Bumrah's a couple of yards in, but he leaps off the ground as that arrives as if it's a close call. Let down by his awareness
good length and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
past the edge! Good length and angled into the corridor. Straightens as he jumps into the off side for the back foot defence
good length outside off, 141kph, left alone
full and into off stump, patted to mid-off
bouncer at off stump, ducks to let it go
shortish, fourth-stump line. Gets up to just above chest height, and Labuschagne keeps it down into the square-leg region with a turn of his wrists on top of the bounce, after getting up on his toes
length ball close to off stump, defends from the crease, to short extra-cover
a touch shorter, gets it to bounce steeply over off stump. Takes the bottom hand off while defending into the on side
length ball on off stump, defended to mid-on
fullish on leg stump, defended to midwicket. Doesn't close his bat face, mindful of that man at leg gully
back of a length on leg stump, defended to midwicket

draws the edge right away, but it doesn't carry to the cordon. Back of a length in the corridor, straightens a little as Labuschange defends from the crease. Plays close to his body, though, and the edge dies as it runs away wide of the diving third slip fielder
back of a length on off stump, defended into the point region
back of a length, a bit of inward movement towards off stump. Labuschagne seems to have all the time in the world to stand tall and defend square on the leg side
length ball on off stump, defended off the front foot, back down the pitch
length ball attacking the top of off stump. Hops, then it skids through lower than he expects, and he squats a little as he defends into the on side
length ball, straightens a little close to off stump. Defended nice and close to his body, rolls away square on the off side
length ball on off stump, jumps back and across, deep in his crease, to defend to midwicket
bouncer outside off, ducks low and ignores it
length ball, nips in towards off stump. Right behind it to defend to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, gets back and across and tucks it to that man at leg gully
back of a length on off stump, right behind it to defend to midwicket
fuller now, on off stump, defended to mid-on. Excellent line from Shami right through this over
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
back of a length outside off, jabbed to point
length ball, a little wider than the previous one, left alone

goes short now, and now it's Prithvi Shaw's turn to drop Labuschagne. Gets up to about chest height just outside off, and maybe it skids on quicker than the batsman expects. Plays a weird, half-hearted, checked pull, and miscues it high over the square leg region, where Shaw, running a short distance backwards and to his left, puts it down
beauty. Back of a length, angling into the fifth-stump channel and straightening past the edge of Smith's defensive bat

how many bowlers beat Smith and find his edge the next ball? Similar delivery, just short of a length outside off, and Smith, shuffling across, pushes out in defence and edges it as it straightens off the deck. Falls short of second slip, Kohli, diving across first slip
short, rising to shoulder height outside off, pulled hard into the ground, bounces to midwicket
back of a length, skids through low towards off stump. Hops, then squats, to defend it
back of a length, fairly wide of off, left alone
length ball close to off stump, straightens a touch. Gets back and across and defends into the cover point region
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
bouncer now, over off stump. Keeps his eye on it and ducks his head off-side of the ball to evade it
length ball slanting in and straightening towards off stump. Smith jumps across and defends to the left of the bowler
now he goes short, and it climbs towards Smith's ribcage. Hops across and plays it down into the leg side with soft hands
bouncer over off stump, ducks down low to evade it
length ball angling into off stump, jumps across and defends to mid-on
length ball on off stump, defended to midwicket
bouncer, climbing steeply over off stump. Crouches down low to get under it
bouncer over the right shoulder. Thinks about hooking, then judges it to be bouncing too steeply and leaves instead, swaying his upper body away from the line
length ball close to off stump, defended into the point region
fullish, wider outside off, looking to see if Labuschagne will drive away from his body. He doesn't
length ball on off stump, clipped to the left of long leg
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
in the blockhole close to off stump, Smith is so deep in his crease that he almost plays this like a half-volley, punching it to short extra-cover
starts with a flat one spinning from off stump, gets across and works it through backward square leg

tossed up on leg stump, clipped to backward square leg, and could Australia have lost their best batsman to a run-out too? Smith hurries out of his crease before being sent back by Labuschagne, and the throw to Ashwin is quick and flat, but the fact that it isn't a direct hit saves Smith as he dives home just in time
tossed up now, on middle stump, skips out of his crease and clips through forward square leg
tossed up slow outside off, stretches out and defends to mid-on
looped up slow on off stump, defended to mid-on

got him, Ashwin has struck with an absolute beauty! He got Smith like this in Dharamsala in 2017, but that was from around the wicket. I don't know if this was meant to go on straight or if it was just natural variation, but he plays back to a length ball just outside off, and it skids through quick, takes the outside edge of his defensive bat, and straight into Ajinkya Rahane's lap at slip. Almost seemed to leave Smith off the pitch, kind of like the Mohammad Nabi arm ball
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length outside off, left alone
length ball angling into middle and off, steps across and clips to deep square leg
length ball on middle and off, gets behind it to clip to square leg
length ball slanting across to off stump. Is Umesh reversing it ever so slightly away from the left-hander? Not sure. Good stride forward to push square on the off side
short ball in the corridor, no room to play an attacking shot. Gets up on his toes to defend into the off side
tossed up outside off, driven into the covers
teasing flight on off stump. Gets forward, careful not to get his front pad in the way, and defends, and gets a thickish outside edge that rolls through the gully region
stays back to a length ball spinning in towards off stump, punches into the cover point region
back of a length spinning away from off, stays back and chops behind square
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
flatter, goes back to an off-stump ball to chop it towards backward point. Ashwin won't mind that shot
short, sits up at chest height just over off stump. Nice short-arm jab to pick the gap between midwicket and deep square leg
length ball outside off, Labuschagne leaves with a swatting motion at the end, making sure no one's missing Smith at the crease
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
back of a length close to off stump, defended to short cover

full, and again, there seems to be a hint of reverse in towards off stump. A touch too full, and Labuschagne is in the perfect position to simply show the full face and punch it back down the ground, between the stumps and the non-striker
back of a length on off stump, defended into the off side
tossed up, drifts in a little towards off stump. Head seems to get too much of a stride forward, almost yorks himself while defending into the on side

appeal for lbw, not given. India think about a review... and they almost don't take it before Kohli makes the gesture with two seconds to go. Again that in-drift, and Head has to play around his front pad in defence. Straightens, misses the inside edge, hits front pad. Did it straighten enough to hit the stumps, given the around-the-wicket angle and the drift? Ooh, umpire's call on leg stump!
flighted and full on off stump, clipped towards mid-on
flatter, angles down leg, clipped to the fielder at backward square leg
good shot, but he had to make sure he hit that well. Length ball, skidding on with the angle towardss top of off. Makes room and punches into the covers
tossed up a bit wider, driven firmly but straight to short cover
short outside off, climbs quite steeply so Labuschagne chooses to leave
back of a length, goes wider of the crease and angles it in. Not too far outside off, but he leaves on length
ooh, nearly an edge. Short, wide ball, and Labuschagne fails to connect with the cut. Not the easiest pitch to cut on because the ball doesn't quite come on as quickly as you might expect
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball close to off stump, straightens a touch. Right behind it to defend back to the bowler
short, rising to chest height over off stump, pulled to deep square leg
anguished cries from the close-in fielders as the crease-bound Labuschagne is hurried into a flick. Hits the inside half of his bat. Could have been lbw if he'd missed
tossed up fuller, gets a stride out to clip to midwicket
