tossed up slow outside off, dips and hits high on the bat after Labuschagne presses forward to defend
a touch short on off stump, chopped to the man at point
flatter, spins towards leg stump, goes back to clip to backward square leg
flat, spins from off to middle-and-leg. Clipped from the crease to midwicket
fullish on middle and leg, clipped to square leg
shortish, tucked off the hip to that man at square leg

full, slanting away from off stump, good stride forward for the checked drive into the covers. Got his head over the ball and made sure he didn't go too hard at it, because it was by no means a half-volley
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended to short extra-cover
bouncer angling in over the stumps, ducks down to get under it
shortish, angling into the corridor outside off. Jumps to ride the bounce and block it back to the bowler
length ball spinning in towards off stump. Stays a little leg-side of the ball and punches past the bowler, towards mid-on
stays back to this length ball on middle and leg, clips to square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, gets forward to clip to mid-on

gone, Ashwin has two! This was flighted, on middle and off or thereabouts, and Head doesn't get a proper stride in to drive. Gets his front leg out of the way because he's worried about lbw, and then looks to clip into the on side, but the ball dips, straightens, hits the outside half of the bat, and pops right back to the bowler at chest height. India are all over Australia now.
nervy first ball. Stuck on the crease to an offbreak that hurries into the stumps. Clips it round the corner, just behind square, and gets a single, but it went off the inside half of the bat
that's the Lyon line and length. Dangled up high outside off. Steps out and blocks it back to the bowler after failing to get to the pitch
fullish, angling into off stump, uses his reach to get a stride in and defend to short cover
length ball in the corridor, left alone
bouncer climbing not particularly steeply over off stump. Green is 6'7', so he has to do quite a bit of work to duck under it
back of a length, fifth-stump line, left alone
length ball, wide-ish line, left alone
back of a length, slants this a bit closer to off stump, and Green leaves again
tossed up on middle stump, clipped wide of mid-on
looped up outside off, and Green steps out to jab it firmly back to the bowler
ooh, Ashwin will like that. Tosses it up high outside off, and Green pushes out in front of his body to defend it back to the bowler. Uses his reach rather than a big stride, but leaves a gap
again, plays well in front of his body while defending off the front foot as this dips and spins in from outside off
tossed up fuller outside off, stretches out to clip into the on side, to the right of midwicket
interesting shot. That's pitched very full, within the stumps, and he gets his front leg out of the way and plays an open-hip sweep to deep square leg
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
fullish, angling into off stump, defended into the covers
full-toss on off stump, looking for the yorker maybe. Punched to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, steps across and works it wristily to fine leg, fine of the man at leg gully
length ball wide of off stump, left alone
back of a length on off stump, jabbed into the gap between short cover and backward point
good length and sliding on outside off, gets forward and gets that past slip off the thick outside edge
oh beauty. Ashwin's nailing the flight. This one loops as Green steps out and forces him to defend
shot! Exhibition of good footwork here from the debutant. Down the pitch last ball, deep in the crease this time. Ashwin strays marginally wide, it's short of a length, and he chops this to point
length at off stump, pushed into the covers off the back foot
short of a length and turning down leg, left alone
full on middle stump, leans in and flicks to midwicket
bouncer down leg side, sways away from it
short and rising outside off, hangs the bat inside the line and lets it go
good length and slanted into the corridor, left alone
good length and into off stump, reaches out and opens the face to steer this straight of gully
full on off stump, defended down the pitch
short of a length on off stump, gets deep in the crease and defends into the leg side
good length and tight on off stump, rising up into his body as he gets forward to defend
steps out and is beaten in flight. Pats it back to the bowler

Kohli lunges low to his right and holds on at midwicket! We saw Lyon extracting bounce from this pitch, and Ashwin has done that with this ball too, albeit it's a short one turning into leg stump. It's there for the pull, but pulling in front of square is hard when there's bounce. Green looks to go over midwicket, it hits the high part of his bat and floats out to Kohli's right. He tracks it and times the leap to his right perfectly. These can be hard if you go early. Kohli goes with both hands and completes the landing perfectly before he takes a bow. Not a bad first innings from Green at all, certainly looked comfortable at the crease, but he doesn't do it long enough
good length and in the corridor, pushed through at 93kph. Patted back down the pitch
floaty full toss on leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
good length on leg stump, defended to short leg
big lbw appeal is turned down. Labuschagne deep in the crease at a length ball, inside edge onto back leg as he looks to defend
<b>past the outside edge.</b. Slams a length in the corridor, Marnus protects his off stump with the full face, this straightens past him
good length and just outside off, solidly defended on the back foot
good length at middle stump, defended to short midwicket off the back foot
short of a length on leg stump, tucked square on the leg side off the back foot
good length and honing in on off stump, defended into the off side. Shami giving nothing away
inside edge as Ashwin draws Paine well in front of his body at a middle stump line. Looks to flick firmly at it, comes off the pad and to midwicket's left
length and turning into leg stump, hurriedly stabbed into the leg side again. Aerial this time. His feet are stuck
tentative and another inside edge. This is pushed through quicker, outside off. Gets forward to defend and it's into his pad
short and sitting up outside off, gets deep in the crease and punches it through cover off the back foot
full on off stump, dead-batted down the pitch
good length at off stump, punched down the pitch off the back foot
short and in the corridor, sways out of the way
good length and into leg stump, hangs the angled out and cops it on the thigh
good length on off stump, defended from deep in the crease
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot

lbw catch behind given and Labuschagne immediately reviews. He is beaten by a peach from Shami. Length ball angled into off and middle, has him scrambling to offer the full face and protect his stumps. But it straightens and takes his back thigh on the way to the keeper. Third umpire has ascertained that there's no edge. It was missing on the lbw
just short of deep square. Short at off stump, pulls slightly off the top part of the bat. Ashwin is in from the boundary but can only get this on the bounce
good length on off, defended down the pitch
good length on off, pushed down the pitch
length outside off, reaches out and drives along the floor to mid-off
short of a length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
good length and straight on outside off, defended into the covers. Nice dip on that one
length and dipping on leg stump, defended with the turn to short leg
good length on off stump, 139.4kph. Jumps up at the batsman a touch as he defends off the outside half
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
sharp bouncer in the corridor, Paine drops the arms and lets that go
good length outside off, left alone
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on middle stump, defended to mid-on
overpitched and drifting away outside off. Gets to the pitch and drives along the floor to mid-off's left
good length and on leg stump, allows that to hit his thigh
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, turning into middle. Gets deep in the crease to defend
good length on leg stump, turning down. Follows with his hands and it trickles to leg slip
good length on leg stump, nudged to square leg off the back foot
good length and just outside off, defended off the back foot
good length and into the corridor. Jabs it to cover's left to steal the run
short at middle stump, swivels and pulls into the turf, out to fine leg
good length on middle stump, defended solidly off the back foot
full toss just outside off, holds his shape and gently pats it between bowler and mid-off. Teases Agarwal as he gives chase but makes the boundary before he can put a slide in
short and down leg side, left alone
flat length ball spinning in towards middle and leg, goes back to clip to midwicket
not the first time Labuschagne has reached out to try and drive Ashwin against the turn. Plays it with a turn of the wrists to mid-off
quicker now, line closer to the stumps, clipped to midwicket
back of a length, goes with the angle just outside off. Goes back for a quiet punch to point
sees him step out and loops one into his toes. Clipped through square leg
legbreak, doesn't turn too much after pitching on leg stump. Clipped to backward square leg
full on middle and leg, clipped to the left of deep square leg
length ball just outside off, gets forward to jab to point
length ball, seems to veer in slightly as Paine looks to flick, hits the outside of his pad. Was going down leg
onto the pads,, clipped into the backward square leg region
back of a length close to off stump, punched into the point region
full outside off, gets forward to block to short cover
length ball straightening towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, lets it come and defends into the cover point region
bouncer just outside off stump, ignores it, swaying his upper body away from the line
length ball on off stump, gets forward for the push into the gap between point and short cover
back of a length on off stump, defended into the off side
good leave. Tight line close to off stump, and it's angling sharply in as Bumrah deliveries usually do, but he leaves on length, trusting the bounce from this surface
back of a length outside off stump, punched crisply off the back foot, past the right hand of the diving backward point fielder
fullish, angling into middle stump, clipped to the right of mid-on
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length on off stump, defended towards mid-on
length ball angling into off and middle, gets across to clip to square leg
back of a length close to off stump, punched to cover point

as the current India coach would say, slashes and shashes hard. Just a touch short outside off, goes hard at it, and though there's extra bounce, he ensures the edge flies over the cordon, over the gap between second slip and gully to be precise
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
superb shot. Back of a length, only a hint of room, and he stands tall and punches with a straight bat between backward point and cover point
back of a length, angling into leg stump. Clipped towards backward square leg
bouncer climbing steeply in the corridor outside off, squats down low and ignores it
length ball angling into off stump, defended to short extra-cover
length ball on middle and off, clipped to square leg
back of a length on middle stump, gets on his toes and plays it down to midwicket

big appeal for lbw as Umesh gets one to keep low, and it's given. I don't think there's much doubt in it, unless it's sliding down leg. Labuschagne thinks long and hard before reviewing, and then he does. Back of a length, and Labuschagne is up on his toes but the ball stays down at knee height and skims below his bat to hit his pad, on the knee roll. No bat. Okay, that's plumb. Struck in front of off stump, and from there it's not going to miss the stumps. Hitting middle and off, says ball-tracking.
length ball on off stump, Cummins blocks it back to Umesh
bouncer now, climbs high over off stump. Crouches hurriedly to evade it

got him, Umesh is on fire here! Short ball, climbs awkwardly at Cummins, and as he tries to fend it away it hits the shoulder of his bat and pops up to gully. Cummins jabbed at it well in front of his body, bottom hand off the handle
back of a length on off stump, Paine blocks it back to Bumrah
looks to go full and at the pads, I think, and ends up sliding a long way down leg
back of a length on off stump, defended into the point region
length ball on middle stump, gets forward to clip to midwicket

bouncer, Paine hooks, aaaaaaaand its.... dropped at the square leg boundary by Mayank Agarwal. Not a new idea for bowlers to bounce Paine, he takes it on, meeting it just outside off stump, and he hits it flat but in the air to Agarwal's right. He seems to have it under control with the reverse-cup, and then it just plops out
back of a length on off stump, defended with soft hands
good ball. He's expecting the bouncer, and Umesh gives him the back-of-a-length ball slanting across. Doesn't get behind the line, just pokes and misses
short now, but sits up a little outside off. Just around waist high, in fact, and Starc muscles it away over wide mid-on
now the bouncer, gets it high near the throat, and Starc fends at it and gloves it, to the right of short leg
length ball on off stump, stays back and punches to short extra-cover
awkward bounce. Slanting across to off stump, back of a length. Looks to work it leg side, and ends up playing it into the off side off the shoulder of the bat
short ball, only gets up to waist height on off stump, pulled along the ground to deep square leg
length ball close to off stump, gets forward to block it back towards Bumrah
length ball on off stump, presses forward and steers to deep point with an open face
back of a length on off stump, punched to extra-cover
length ball on off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and clips towards mid-on
back of a length on off stump, steps across and works it through backward square leg
back of a length, strays a little too straight, tucked off the hip to long leg
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs gently into the cover point region
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers

ooh, could have gone anywhere. Back of a length, climbs awkwardly as Starc gets squared up in defence, by the angle across him. Hits the shoulder of his bat and pops up into the gap between gully and backward point
back of a length close to off stump, chopped to deep point
Starc continues looking awkward against the short ball. Digs it in short, and he's through his pull too early. Smacks him on the left shoulder
short again, over off stump, controls the pull well, out to the man at deep square leg
back of a length, angling into off stump, clipped to deep square leg
length ball on middle stump, defended back towards the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, clipped to the straighter of the two midwickets
length ball on the pads, clipped down to long leg
ooh, through him. Yorker, sneaks under the bat as Starc jams down on it, and how did that miss off stump?

follows up with the bouncer at the back shoulder, and he produces the top-edged hook, and another chance, and this time, it's Saha who puts it down, but this is an incredibly difficult one. He has to turn around and run towards the boundary, and track the ball as it drops down from a great height. Ends up a couple of feet to the right of the ball as it falls, and then he sticks out a glove and it doesn't stick
angling down leg now, tucked off the hip towards long leg
length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
full on off stump, clipped to midwicket
beauty. Length ball in the corridor, straightens off the pitch and past the edge as Paine presses forward and jabs at it, slightly away from his body
full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
shortish in the corridor, lets it come on and dabs to backward point

full on leg stump, clipped to the right of deep backward square leg, and they chance a second run, only to produce a loud run-out appeal... It goes up to the third umpire, and Starc is gone by about a foot at the striker's end. Not sure who it was at the deep - excellent flat throw on the bounce to Saha. It's Shaw, I think.
tossed up slow outside off, and Lyon presses forward to block it back to his offspin counterpart
flatter, spins in towards off stump, punched into the covers
just short of a length, spinning in towards off stump, goes back and defends into the on side
quicker, spinning in towards middle stump. Stays back and hurries into a leg-side clip
slower now, length ball pitching just outside off, gets forward and across to lap it fine, sending Shaw into a big chase from backward square leg
back of a length close to off stump. A bit of inward movement, and the attempted punch through the covers ends up at midwicket, off the inside edge
length ball on off stump, gets forward, lets it come on, and nudges it through square leg
back of a length on middle and leg, clipped watchfully to midwicket
length ball on middle stump, clipped through square leg
short in the corridor, leaves it alone, pulling his bat and gloves away from the line
great fielding. Length ball, looks to flick it off the stumps, and it's flying quickly to leg gully's right. Excellent diving stop. Was that Pujara? Not sure
length ball spinning into off stump, stays back to punch towards mid-on
tossed up outside off, driven to the left of mid-off
flat length ball that skids straight on towards off stump. Goes back and punches it back to Ashwin
appeal for lbw as Lyon misses the sweep. Impact was outside off, I think
flighted ball pitching just outside off. Stretches forward to block it back to the bowler

big appeal for lbw, and it's given. That's his fourth, if this review goes the umpire's way... Nope. Thick inside edge. Tossed up, inviting him forward, and it dips to make him stretch and draw his bat in front of his body to defend. The umpire thought it had spun past the edge to hit pad, but it's taken a thick deflection along the way
short, a bit of width, and Paine brings up his half-century with a square cut past the left hand of the diving backward point fielder. What a valuable innings this is
and now he beats the edge. Length ball, angling into the fourth-stump channel and straightening away. Beaten as he comes forward to defend
length ball pitching outside off, angling in. Looks to shuffle across and work it leg side, misses and is hit on the pad, outside the line
shortish outside off, and Paine has a big slash at it. Flies away over the gap between slip and gully
ooh, beats him again. Fullish, and it nips away like a legcutter to beat the attempted drive through mid-off
Paine steps out of his crease, and Shami, seeing this, shortens his length. Offers him width too, though, and he uses that to steer it to deep point to stay on strike
short of a length and turning into the hips, gets deep in the crease and jabs that to deep backwars square
good length and turning into off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length and rising onto the hip. Gets deep in the crease and gets the glance past leg slip

big appeal for lbw as Lyon sweeps. Ashwin is convinced that's out. Convinces Kohli to review. It does look close. A quicker one at a good length. Lyon shuffled into the off side as he attempted the shot. The ball did turn though, and might well have hit him in line with the stumps. On the front foot. But - there is a hot spot on the bat. Inside half of the bat. He's safe
good length on off stump, leans in and flicks to deep backward square
good length ad pushed through at leg stump, stabbed to midwicket off the front foot
good length at off stump, defended on the back foot

oh you beauty! Top-drawer pull shot through midwicket from Lyon. Short of a length and just outside off. Not a ball you generally hit of the back foot. But he's deep and he swivels to get the weight through this, bat pointed downwards and a slap into the turf
good length on off, defended solidly on the back foot
past the outside edge. Short of a length and straightening as he closes the face for the one that slants in
good length at off stump, defended on the back foot
overpitched on the pads, a crisp flick along the ground to deep square

evades Saha who is diving in the direction of short leg. Short leg was taking evasive action against Lyon's sweep and couldn't quite reach out to his right. That came off the glove, a riser from outside off
good length and climbing outside off, gets down and sweeps to short fine's left
full on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket

chipped straight to short midwicket. It is a slow pitch, and that's on display here. Short of a length, cross-seam offbreak into the hips. He wants to turn that behind square off the back foot but closes the face early. Kohli holds on, smiles wide and breaths a sigh of relief
full on middle stump, tapped into the leg side with the angle
refuses the single. Good length outside off, a handsome punch out to deep point
good length at middle stump, defended off the inside part through square leg. Refuses the run again
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length and angled into off stump from wide of the crease. Pushes it past the bowler off the front foot and takes the run
good length and into the stumps, blocked on the front foot
bouncer at middle stump, backs away and lets it go
short of a length at off, backs away and cuts to sweeper's left. Thought he had a second there but Shami puts in a good throw to stop them coming back
drilled past the non-striker. Tossed up at leg stump, clears the front leg and swings cleanly. All along the ground
full at leg stump, blocked on the front foot

chipped over mid-on! Beautiful couple of boundaries here from Hazlewood. Picked his spots and executed perfectly. This is a length ball slanted into middle and leg. Perhaps a bit flatter. He uses his reach and the angle to loft this with a full face offered
good length at middle stump, blocked on the front foot
fuller and into leg stump. Neatly blocked on the front foot
length ball close to off stump, defended into the covers
full on off stump, defended to mid-off
shortish, angling into off stump with some extra bounce. Jumps up to ride the bounce and keep it down into the leg side with a turn of the wrists
length ball on off stump, defended to midwicket
short on off stump, gets up to chest height, pulled to deep square leg
short, angling in and climbing over middle stump. Stays leg-side of the ball and uses his height to get on top of the bounce and defend into the covers
shot. Tossed up outside off, and Paine knows most of the fielders are on the leg side. No one behind square on the off side, and he reverse-sweeps firmly into that wide open area
flat offbreak spinning in towards leg stump. Cramped for room as he looks to create some. Punched to short extra-cover
shortish, but it sticks in the pitch as he looks to make room again. Flat-batted down to mid-off
flat legbreak, zips past the outside edge just outside off as Paine looks to make room and cut
tossed up on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
shortish, a bit of width, chopped to the right of backward point to keep the strike
full and into leg stump, allows that on and flicks to deep square's left elegantly. Easy two there
good length and just outside off, waits on this one too and pats it expertly to sweeper's right for another easy two
good length and in at off stump. Defends to cover
good length and into middle stump, pushed to mid-on with the angle
good length at off stump, looks to drop that off side to pinch the run, but times it too well. Point is on it quickly
top edge runs away fine. Short ball wide outside off. Looks to hook towards deep square with the face closed, ends up with three bonus runs. That's eight off the over

taken at slip. A sharp take too, from Pujara at first slip. Short ball at middle and leg. He backs away and looks to steer that over the cordon. He's done alright with the technique, but needs a couple of more inches on that to clear the leaping fielder. Nice hang time from Pujara as he gets to hands on that
140.9kph, short of a length and curving down leg side. Shuffles to get inside the line and glances that to fine leg
good length and just outside off, defended to gully off the back foot
good length and wide outside off, left alone
rapped on the pads and an appeal that dies out pretty quickly. Slight curve into leg stump as Agarwal's head falls over on the flick. Going down
just manages to get the bat down. Decently played in the end. 143kph and swinging in big from an off stump line. Keeps the stride short and defends very very late into the leg side
short and coming in from an off stump line. Lets it go on bounce
good length on leg stump, punched on the up to mid-on
oh nicely punched. Searches for swing, gets that full and on middle stump. Shaw has the front leg out of the way as he brings down a straight bat for runs past mid-on
good length on leg stump, defended to short leg off the back foot
floaty full ball at the toes, waits on it and jams it wide of mid-on

dropped! Paine sticks out his right hand and can't hold on to an edge that's carried. Mayank pushes on the front foot as this straightens in the corridor. Lovely line, can't not be playing at that. This might have carried to first slip, but Paine's flown and grassed it
good length and into the body, defended hurriedly into the leg side
just short of extra cover. Good length and sticking in the pitch outside off as he pushes away from the body with hard hands
inside edge onto pad. Pinned very deep in the crease and tentative as he goes back to good length delivery shaping into him
good length and pitching in the corridor. Goes away off the pitch Left alone
good length and curving into the corridor, left alone

through him! A far too familiar picture for those who've followed Shaw over the last year. Good length, landing on a seam outside off, nips back in sharply as Shaw gets forward to defend. He's too slow on it, the front foot still in motion as the ball goes through the gap and tonks the stumps
full and into off stump, shuffles and defends into the leg side
good length in the corridor, expected that to rise the way he dropped his arms. Left alone
full and into off stump, pushed back down the pitch
bouncer at middle stump, ducks under it rapidly
full and just outside off, defended into the covers
short of a length and rising above middle stump, left alone
good length at leg stump, defended to short leg off the back foot
full and swinging down leg side, can't get bat on the attempted flick
good length and across the corridor, left alone
inswinging yorker at middle stump, digs it out into the off side
full and just outside off, stays leg side of that, small stride and jammed through the vacant covers area
full and in the corridor. Walks into the line of that and blocks on the front foot
good length and into off stump. Shuffles and pushes that past short leg. They don't take the single
good length on off stump, solidly behind that to defend on the front foot
bouncer down leg side, left alone
full at off stump, pushed back down the pitch
short of a length and very wide outside off. Left alone
lbw appeal first up, as Agarwal looks to drive down the ground and a fair bit in front of his body. A bit of inward movement after slanting across, but a thick inside edge into front pad

yikes, this has been a loose start from Agarwal. A little fuller, and a fair bit wider outside off, continuing on with the angle. Not much of a front-foot stride, and a wild drive away from his body. Beaten
back of a length, slanting away from off stump, left alone
full, swings into the pads, and Agarwal flicks it away to the left of the man at short leg
length ball slanting into that wide channel, asking Agarwal if he wants to try driving again. Left alone
wide length ball, left alone
and here's Bumrah. Length ball in the corridor, and he presses forward and drives away from his body, with an open face, and slices into the gap between backward point and gully
length ball angling into middle stump, defended from the crease, into the on side
length ball straightening towards off stump, and that's superbly played, looked like a proper batsman. Got right behind it, let it move, and defended right under his eyes, square on the off side
well bowled. Shifts his line slightly wider, gets the same movement away, and Bumrah pokes away from his body and misses
well played again. Dug in short, and Bumrah manages to keep his eye on the ball and sway his head away, the momentum making him fall towards the leg side momentarily

got him, Cummins has taken very little time to take out the nightwatchman. Fullish, angling into off stump and straightening. Was it the slower legcutter? Possibly. Either way, he gets Bumrah to push at it in front of his body, without much of a stride prior to that, and the ball pops back for a return catch at waist height
length ball, straightens into Agarwal on a middle-and-off line, gets behind it to defend it back to the bowler
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
fullish on off stump, good stride forward to punch to short extra-cover
bouncer over middle stump, Agarwal ducks hurriedly under it
length ball slanting into the fourth-stump channel. Presses forward and blocks into the cover point region

fuller now, angling across into the fourth-stump corridor. Drives with a slightly angled bat, plays a little early too, and the ball hits the inside half of his bat and rolls to short extra-cover/wide mid-off/whatever you want to call that fielder
back of a length, fifth-stump line, reaches out a little to jab into the point region
fullish, angling into middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
fullish, angling into off stump, presses forward and blocks into the off side, towards wide mid-off
short now, in the corridor, left alone
well played. Length ball, nipping in from an off-stump line. Stays back, lets it come, and defends into the off side with his front pad not getting into the line of the movement
length ball in the fifth-stump channel, left alone
length ball, slanting into too wide a line to make Agarwal play
back of a length close to  off stump, defended into the gully region with an open face
length ball slanting across to off stump, defended into the point region, with the bat coming down at an angle and slicing across the line slightly. Off the outside half of the bat
short now, angling away from off stump. Jumps, thinks about having a jab at it, then pulls his bat away in a hurry
bouncer over leg stump, ducks down low, left knee on the floor, to get under it

phew, that's a ripper. Back of a length, and the initial line is heading towards off stump so Agarwal is forced to play. Then it nips away off the seam with extra bounce, and squares Agarwal up while beating his edge. Did very well not to follow it with his hands
length ball outside off, left alone

Cummins is bringing Australia right back into this game. Superb delivery, angling into middle and off and straightening. Pujara absolutely has to play, the length is perfect. The feet don't go anywhere, and even though he plays as close to the body as possible, it moves just enough to take his edge and no more. His bat face is ever so slightly closed, suggesting he was playing the initial angle
shortish, nips in from outside off, jumps up to ride the bounce and defend into the on side
back of a length outside off, steep bounce after Kohli leaves and Paine takes it over his head
back of a length in the corridor, straightens past the edge as Kohli steps back and across to defend. This is fiery stuff
length ball, a bit of extra bounce as it seams in towards middle stump. Clipped down towards short leg

and he strikes first ball. Wow. The most Josh Hazlewood dismissal you'll see. Extra bounce from a length, and the initial angle - much like the Pujara dismissal - isn't even attacking off stump but going slightly inside the line of the stumps. Then it straightens to take the edge, with Agarwal squared up in defence
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
length ball outside off, a bit of seam movement away, left alone
phew. What a great line this is, so tight on off stump, and Rahane has no option but to play. Straightens and zips past the edge. The length is more or less perfect too

I said the length was more or less perfect the previous ball. This one was a few inches fuller, along the same line, and the ball straightened again to take the edge. India are effectively 68 for 5. Rahane doesn't get a stride forward, just pushes at the ball, in front of his body, and pays the price
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
length ball on off stump, gets a stride forward to defend towards gully
fullish in the corridor, left alone
shortish in the corridor, hops and jabs it away on top of the bounce, past the right hand of the diving gully fielder

now Cummins has the Kohli wicket. I think all the wickets at the other end have unsettled Kohli, and made him decide he has to take on the bowling. Fullish in a wide-ish channel outside off, and Kohli does something he didn't do at all in the first innings, attempt a cover drive against such a ball. Slices it to gully, where Green seems to have taken a clean catch low to his left, but they're checking anyway. Soft signal is out. He caught it a few inches above the turf, but the issue is whether it slipped momentarily from his grasp on his way down. There seems to be a bit of a juggle, but it's hard to tell, given he's landing in an area of shadow, so it stays with the soft signal
back of a length, straightens towards off stump, defended into the point region
length ball angling in towards middle stump, defended back down the pitch
back of a length outside off, left alone
length ball with some gentle outswing in the corridor. Vihari leaves it, playing well inside the line deliberately
extra bounce now, and some seam in from the corridor. Vihari tries to keep it out hurriedly, but it goes past his inside edge and hits thigh pad
length ball straightening towards off stump. Some extra bounce again. Vihari looks to clip it leg side, and is hit on the thigh pad again
length ball on off stump, clipped to midwicket
fullish, angling in towards off stump with slight nibble away. Defended into the covers
past the edge again. Length ball nipping away outside off. Has a drive at it, away from his body, and can't connect
digs it in short, over off stump. Gets down low and sways his upper body away from the line
back of a length, extra bounce close to off stump, looks to leave, and gets an inside edge down to fine leg
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length, tight line around off stump, leaves it on length
length ball, angling into middle stump and straightening away. Looks to play the angle and clip into the leg side, gets a leading edge into the covers
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length outside off. Thinks about cutting, but decides against it seeing how steeply it bounced
length ball on middle and off, clipped to the right of mid-on
fullish on off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, left alone
fullish, angling into middle stump, gets his head over the ball and clips through square leg
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
length ball close to off stump, good stride forward to block into the point region
a touch too full outside off, and Vihari presses forward and punches it away through cover point
back of a length, nipping in towards the hip, defended into the on side
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball on off stump, defended to mid-on
good length and in at middle stump, defended to short leg with soft hands
good length and just outside off, solidly forward to defend
short and rising wide of the corridor, lets that go

chipped straight to midwicket! There is no stop to this carnage. What a treat to watch this guy bowl. Not his best delivery of the morning by any stretch, but everything around this delivery means Saha has gone with hard hands at a ball dipping into his leg stump. It's a good length delivery, he reaches out and looks to close the face. He's not close enough to do that and that's off the inside part of a turning bat

there's a sound and the umpire's heard it too. Ashwin reviews the catch behind. Good length, landing on the seam in the corridor. Jags away the tiniest bit from the surface. Ashwin is caught inside the line on the forward defence...there's nothing on Hotspot. But Snicko has the slightest murmur. Ashwin will go first ball. Wicket number 200 for Hazlewood and now he's on a hat-trick
inside edge onto the pad. Decently played, in that he's got behind the line. It's a good length ball seaming into his body and he brings down an angled bat
good length and just outside off, gets forward and defends to cover's left

handsome. Vihari gets his weight onto the back foot and on top of the bounce of this, short of a length and rising outside off. He's in position perfectly and executes a deft square cut, along the floor
stabbed to gully. Short of a length and tucking him at an off stump. Arches into the leg side to try and squeeze this through the cordon
good length on off stump, defended into the coves from the crease
good length and slanted in at middle stump. Gets forward and hurriedly pokes this into the leg side for the single
inside edge onto pad again for Umesh. Good length outside off, reaches out in front of his body for this

that's five for Hazlewood! Take a bow, you absolute beast. What a spell. So persistent, near-perfect this morning. It's another trademark dismissal - draw the batsman in with the angle in at the stumps, straighten it off the surface to draw the edge. And the edges are carrying today. Vihari on the front foot, thick outside edge, and Paine lunges to his right with two hands to hold on
good length at off stump, solidly behind the line to defend into the covers
good length and into middle stump. Gets deep in the crease and punches to deep midwicket
good length at off stump, defended on the back foot
hacks at it and gets it down to fine leg. Short ball rising outside off, gives it a heave from underneath and the top edge brings him runs
full and dipping into off stump. Driven back to the bowler
ducks and swishes at the same time. It's gone past him quickly. A bouncer at a leg stump line

can't get out of the way. Short ball, doesn't quite rise as much. It's headed down leg side. Shami is backing into the leg side and trying to evade. Cops that on his right forearm and the team doctor is out
good length and just outside off, left alone
slashed over point. Full and wide outside off, not a lot of swing on that. Chucks the hands at it and he's away
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full and down leg side, can't get bat on the attempted flick
full at off stump, 140.5kph. Blocked on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
appeal for catch behind after a deflection. But that's off his right thigh. Short of a length, straightening and rising in the corridor
good length outside off, left alone
good length and wide of the corridor, left alone
length and in at off stump, defended on the back foot
full and into the corridor, mistimed drive into the covers
good length and into off stump, defended into the covers
full and wide outside off, 139kph. Leans into that and opens the face late to get this drive through the covers
good length on off stump, defended into the covers
good length and just outside off, blocked on the front foot
good length and across the corridor, left alone
good length, 139.1kph, away from the corridor. Left alone
good length and pushed across off stump, left alone

now Burns is struck on the forearm. Left arm. Short ball, not quite as high as he expects it to be as he's looking to let that flay past his shoulder. Ends up in a strange position, arms up. In fact, that might have even got him on the elbow. But his arm is mobile as he waits for the physio. No physio, in fact. He's okay to continue
good length and slanted into the corridor. Left alone
good length and just outside off, comes on nicely at 141.5kph. Stands tall and punches it to mid-off's right
bouncer angled into the body. Ducks under that
steered past gully. Short of a length, rising in the corridor. Waits on that and is on top of the bounce as he opens the face late on this to find the gap in the cordon
good length and in at middle stump, defended on the back foot
bouncer hits something in the pitch and flies down leg side, left alone
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length and jumping into the body from outside off as he gets forward to defend
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
bouncer in the corridor, ducks under that
short at the ribs, jumps to get behind that and drops it into the leg side. Wade scampers down and is sent back. The direct hit catches him well inside at the other end
appeal first up as Wade comes forward to play one angled into his off stump. He wants to push into the covers, and he manages it via a thick inside-edge into his pad
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and defends towards backward point
length ball angling into middle stump, defended back to the bowler, his bat slicing across his front pad a little
back of a length in the corridor, straightens a touch as Burns defends with an open face. Runs away off the outside half of the bat between third slip and gully
bouncer now, angling slightly down leg. Steps across and lets it go past his left shoulder
length ball slanting across to off stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball slanting away from off stump, uses his wrists to try and pick up a leg-side single, but square leg moves quickly to his left to stop it
full, slanting away from off, left alone
length ball on the pads, worked away through backward square leg
short now, rears up as it slants across the batsman. Jabs at it as it rises to shoulder height, pulling his bottom hand off the handle, and the thick edge runs away between the slips and gully
short on off stump, sits up a little, and Burns can swivel and pull it away in front of square
length ball close to off stump, opens his bat face and steers it wide of gully
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
shortish in the corridor, Burns gets a thick edge as he defends with hard hands, runs away through point
back of a length outside off, left alone
short outside off, and Burns seems to be waiting for it. Pounces with a fierce pull between the square leg umpire and the fielder at midwicket
bouncer outside off, Burns ducks and avoids it
length ball outside off, presses forward and pushes into the cover point region
back of a length, angling down leg. Looks to work it away but all he gets on the ball is thigh pad. Four runs either way, though
length ball outside off, left alone
overpitched outside off, gets forward and drives with an open face to the right of backward point
digs it in short, and Wade gets into a closed-off position while trying to negotiate it. Looks to fend it away, gets hit on the chest, with maybe a bit of glove on the way through
bouncer, angles well down the leg side. Wade ducks without too much discomfort
short, at the hip, gets across and gets closed-off again. Can't get his bat around his body in time to flick it off his hip, so just steps across and leaves it instead
steps out but can't get to the pitch of this flighted ball. Looks to flick, and it's off the inside half of the bat between leg slip and short leg
a touch shorter, goes back to work it to backward square leg
wow. He's looking to finish it early. Steps out and has a mighty slog at this, but it dips and turns and misses his edge to hit his front leg
length ball, quicker, on the stumps, goes back to clip to midwicket
flat on the pads, clipped to backward square leg
tossed up just outside off, stretches out and blocks it back
length ball angling into off stump, punched into the covers
length ball, stops on the pitch slightly and nips in towards off stump. He's almost searching for the ball while trying to flick it. Inside-edged into pad
length ball nipping in slightly towards middle stump, nudged to the left of midwicket
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, gets across to work it through square leg. Brings up Australia's 50
back of a length close to off stump, shuffles across to defend, gets a thick edge that rolls into the backward point region

big appeal as Burns falls over a flick, playing around his front pad. India will keep targeting him there right through this series. Not given, and Kohli thinks for a while before agreeing to review. Could be going down leg, possibly? Nope, inside-edge onto pad
length ball skidding on towards off stump, goes back to punch it back to the bowler
flighted ball on middle and leg, bat has to come down at an angle to defend in front of his pad
skips out but comes too early. Ashwin shortens his length a little and he stretches out to defend into the off side
nicely bowled. Dips onto a length around off stump. Again Wade's bat comes down at an angle while defending, and the ball turns to take the outside edge and roll behind square on the off side
quick turn as Burns goes on the back foot to defend. Bounces too, hits him on the thigh pad
hurries Burns into a defensive shot again, cramps him for room on the back foot. Jammed down into the off side
full, angling into off stump, gets forward to defend, nice and close to the pitch of the ball
full again, driven to mid-off
length ball angling in, not too far outside off. Leaves on length as much as line
length ball angling into off stump. Looks to punch through the covers, hits the inside half of the bat and goes to midwicket instead
length ball close to off stump, defends with soft hands, to the left of backward point
short now, on off stump, pulled to deep square leg
goes back to a length ball and clips to backward square leg
on the back foot again, this one pitches slightly wider outside off, and he can stay leg-side of it and punch through cover point
full, angling in towards leg stump, clipped to midwicket
tossed up invitingly outside off, left alone. This went with the angle
tossed up fuller outside off, presses forward and blocks to cover point

once again that's flighted slow outside off, and Wade gets down low to sweep it hard, into the ground and then the right shoulder of the fielder at short leg. He looks in pain here... Vihari the fielder.
length ball angling into off stump, gets right behind it to defend
length ball on off stump, gets forward to clip to mid-on
full, angling into off stump, clipped to midwicket
bouncer, angling in over the stumps, Wade's initial movement is a forward press, but he ducks it comfortably enough
back of a length, not far from off stump, good leave
length ball close to off stump, blocked back towards Bumrah
tossed up just outside off, thinks of stepping out but can only go so far before having to clip it back to the bowler
this time he does get out of his crease, quick footwork to get to the pitch of this flighted one, get his front leg away from the line, and whip it back past the stumps at the other end
sharp turn, past the front-foot flick and down the leg side
down the track again, confident footwork, and this time he's just far enough from the ball to extend his arms and loft it back over the bowler
flat, turning down leg, clipped to leg gully
tossed up just outside off, dips on Burns a bit, forces him to clip to midwicket rather than straighter as he'd hoped
back of a length, tucked off the hip to long leg

digs it in short, and Burns gets a slice of luck. Looks to pull, the ball sticks in the pitch momentarily and then climbs higher than expected, just outside off. Top edge, flies high but beyond the reach of square leg turning around and running back
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
angles into the pads now, clipped to long leg
shortish, rising ball on off stump. Hits the shoulder of his bat as he looks to defend, squeezes it away between gully and backward point

length ball angling into off stump. Went slightly wider on the crease there, possibly. Looks to drive into the covers with a bit of a gap between bat and pad. Hits the inside half of the bat and bounces down into the pitch
full, angling into leg stump, clipped to short leg

oh well, India will take that. Bizarre dismissal. Down the track and Ashwin spots him coming and fires it into his feet. Clips into the on side, straight into Shaw's right leg at short leg, and the ball rolls quickly to Saha with Wade well out of his crease. He picks up quickly to his right and gets a backhand flick between his legs without looking. A direct hit with Wade slipping and caught well outside the crease

Shaw's lost the ball as he takes an evasive stance at short leg. Marnus down the pitch, beaten in flight looing to hack it into the leg side. Not sure if there was an inside edge on that. Lobbed to Shaw's left and he was looking behind initially. Couldn't spot it
short of a length at off stump, cuts to cover point
good length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side with the turn
tossed up outside off, blocked on the front foot
full on middle stump, leans in and flicks to deep square
full and into the pads again, flicked to deep square
good length and just outside off, drives on the rise and that pings off the thick outside edge through point
good length at off stump, defended on the back foot
short at off stump, nicely on top of the bounce to pull this to deep square's left
bouncer at a middle and leg stump line. Ducks to let that go
short of a length on leg stump, pushed to backward square with the turn
swatted past backward square! Burns is a new man today. Full on leg stump, quickly in position, down on one knee, and a nice clean bat swing as he sweeps this fine
good length and turning down leg. Gets on the back foot and dabs to fine leg
short of a length and turning into the corridor, deep in the crease to chop to point

taken at mid-on. Ashwin still on the mark like he was in the first innings. Beautifully dipping length ball just outside off, slowing it down because Labuschagne has looked impatient. Steps out and looks to cart it over midwicket. It drops on him and then gets big. He can only sky it
tossed up at middle stump, leans in and defends to short leg
good length on leg stump, shuffles and clips to deep square
slashed past point. Good length and sliding on wide outside off. Half a stride out, reaches for it with his hands and drives it into the ground
good length at leg stump, flicked to backward square
beaten. Short of a length and just outside off. Burns looks to roll his hands over that and steer it behind point. Gets too big on him
short at middle stump, on his toes to defend into the leg side

tipped over by fine leg! A win for Australia, a fifty for Burns. Short ball climbing up at leg stump, shifts his weight back and across and hooks aerially. The fielder at fine leg lunges backwards and to his right, one-handed. Gets his hand on it but can't keep his balance
